artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Artist: Kobayashi Toshimitsu; Publisher: Yorozuya Magobei
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 297; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 295.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three sheets; group of soldiers at right wearing green pants, red blouses and black caps, advancing with guns on a group of predominately shirtless figures with spears across a narrow chasm; rugged cliff at left; rocky mountains at right; water in middle ground
dimension: 14 1/2 × 9 3/4 in. (36.83 × 24.77 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 応需大蘇芳年 {ōju Taiso Yoshitoshi} | 助筆高斎年充 {sukehitsu Kōsai Toshimitsu}
text: With assistance of Kōsai Toshimitsu. The battle was in May 1874 and this print must have been issue shortly thereafter.
title: The Taiwan News: Advance on Shimen during the Subjugation of Mudan
